text: data frame (actually tibble) summary statistics model parameters returned. parameters, indicated variable column, : alpha: Average baseline log hazard.  covariates, describes average hazard continuous covariates set zero, factor covariates set baseline levels. coefs: Coefficients M-spline basis terms.  non-proportional hazards model fitted, covariates set zero baseline levels. loghr: Log hazard ratios covariate model. cure models, refers covariates survival uncured people.  non-proportional hazards models, effects covariates scale parameter eta represent "average" hazard ratios, departures modelled (see "methods" vignette full description model). hr: Hazard ratios (exponentials loghr). pcure: Probability cure (cure models ).   covariates cure, parameter describes probability cure continuous covariates set zero, factor covariates set baseline levels. logor_cure: Log odds ratio cure covariate cure. or_cure: Odds ratios cure (exponentials logor_cure). nperr: Standardised departures proportional hazards non-proportional hazards model, defined \(b^{(np)}_{ks} / \sigma^{(np)}_s\) (see "methods" vignette definitions ). sd_np: Smoothness standard deviations \(\sigma^{(np)}_s\) non-proportionality effects.

title: Flexible Bayesian parametric survival models — survextrap
code: survextrap(   formula,   data,   external = NULL,   smooth_sd = "bayes",   coefs_mean = NULL,   cure = FALSE,   nonprop = FALSE,   prior_loghaz = p_normal(0, 20),   prior_loghr = NULL,   prior_smooth = p_gamma(2, 1),   prior_cure = p_beta(1, 1),   prior_logor_cure = NULL,   prior_sdnp = p_gamma(2, 1),   backhaz = NULL,   basehaz_ops = NULL,   modelid = "mspline",   fit_method = "mcmc",   loo = (fit_method == "mcmc"),   ... )

title: Flexible Bayesian parametric survival models — survextrap
text: formula survival formula standard R formula syntax, call Surv() left hand side. Covariates included right hand side formula modelled proportional hazards. data Data frame containing variables formula. external External data data frame aggregate survival counts columns: start: Start time start: Follow-time n: Number people alive start r: Number people still alive stop intended add facilities package produce format data common forms external data, e.g. registry population data, elicited judgements conditional survival smooth_sd Smoothing parameter estimation. "bayes": smoothing parameter estimated full Bayes. "eb": empirical Bayes used. Alternatively, number supplied , smoothing parameter fixed number. coefs_mean Spline basis coefficients define prior mean hazard function. default, set values define constant hazard function.  normalised sum 1 internally (already). cure TRUE, mixture cure model used. nonprop TRUE non-proportional hazards model fitted. achieved modelling spline basis weights terms covariates.  See "methods" vignette details.   models multiple covariates, currently way assume covariates proportional hazards others - none. prior_loghaz Prior baseline log hazard. call prior constructor function, p_normal(0,1) p_t(0,2,2).   Supported prior distribution families normal (parameters mean SD) t distributions (parameters location, scale degrees freedom).  default normal(0, 20). "Baseline" defined continuous covariates taking value zero factor covariates taking reference level.  use different baseline, data transformed appropriately beforehand, value zero different meaning. continuous covariates, helps computation interpretation define value zero denote typical value data, e.g. mean. prior_loghr Priors log hazard ratios.  call p_normal() p_t().  list calls can also provided, give different priors different coefficients, name list component matches name coefficient, e.g. list("age45-59" = p_normal(0,1), "age60+" = p_t(0,2,3)). default p_normal(0,2.5) coefficients. prior_smooth Gamma prior smoothing standard deviation, models estimated.  call p_gamma().  default p_gamma(2,1). prior_cure Prior baseline cure probability.  call p_beta().  default uniform prior, p_beta(1,1). Baseline defined mean continuous covariates reference level factor covariates. prior_logor_cure Priors log odds ratios cure probabilities. call p_normal() p_t().  default p_normal(0,2.5). prior_sdnp Prior standard deviation parameters smooth non-proportionality effects time non-proportional hazards models.  call p_gamma() list calls p_gamma() one component per covariate, prior_loghr. backhaz Name variable data giving background hazard relative survival models.  censored cases exact value matter. parameter estimates results models describe excess hazard survival top background. external data backhaz supplied, user also supply background survival start stop points columns external data named "backsurv_start" "backsurv_stop".  describe reference population backhaz, though package check consistency . basehaz_ops list control parameters defining spline model. iknots: Internal knots.  supplied, number knots taken df, location taken equally-spaced quantiles observed event times (concatenated distinct follow-times external data). bknots: Boundary knots.  supplied, boundary knots set zero maximum event time (including follow-times external data). df: Degrees freedom, .e. number parameters (basis terms) define hazard spline function time.  Defaults 10.  Note necessarily overfit function smoothed prior. degree: Polynomial degree used basis function. default 3, giving cubic. modelid "mspline" default M-spline model. current alternative "weibull" Weibull accelerated failure time model. just included purpose package testing.  fully implemented, recommended use practice survival extrapolation. fit_method Method rstan used fit model.  Defaults MCMC. fit_method="mcmc" sample posterior drawn using Markov Chain Monte Carlo sampling, via rstan's rstan::sampling() function. default.  accurate slowest method. fit_method="opt", instead MCMC sample posterior, survextrap returns posterior mode calculated using optimisation, via rstan's rstan::optimizing() function. sample normal approximation (real-line-transformed) posterior distribution drawn order obtain credible intervals. fit_method="vb", variational Bayes methods used, via rstan's rstan::vb() function.  labelled "experimental" rstan.  might give better approximation posterior fit_method="opt", investigated depth models. loo Compute leave-one-cross-validation statistics.  done default. Set FALSE compute . statistics computed, returned loo component object returned survextrap.  See "examples" vignette explanation . ... Additional arguments supply control Stan fit, passed appropriate rstan function, depending chosen fit_method argument.

title: M-spline survival distribution — Survmspline
text: dsurvmspline gives density, psurvmspline gives distribution function, hsurvmspline gives hazard Hsurvmspline gives cumulative hazard. qsurvmspline gives quantile function, computed numerical inversion. rsurvmspline generates random survival times using qsurvmspline sample uniform random numbers.
